column5: I took these pics this AM,the suckers come into the shallows by my dock to spawn every spring,they are a couple weeks early this year.http://i631.photobucket.com/albums/u...Lake/001-8.jpghttp://i631.photobucket.com/albums/u...Lake/005-1.jpghttp://i631.photobucket.com/albums/u...Lake/004-1.jpg
If there were any big pike around they would have a quick meal !

I have a neat story about your lake. Back in the early 80's I was fishing there in with my parents and saw a school of suckers (Blue Lake lives on a lake that is "gin clear") that must have consisted of 2 to 3 hundred fish. In the middle of them was a larger, darker fish - swiming right with them just as if it was schooling with them - a muskie of about 25 lbs... I cast in front of it and past it about thirty feet with a bucktail. The fish didn't scatter until the muskie sensed the bait and went "on point." At that point, the suckers scattered in every direction as the muskie started to follow to the boat. He didn't hit, but it was cool/weird to see how they react to a predator's posture and such...DC
Does your lake stay clear all year or does it only stay clear in spring ?A lot of gin clear lakes back in the 1960's & early 1970's are no longer gin clear by late July.
It stays crystal clear year round,you can easily see bottom in 20 ft of water on a calm day.
Lotta good pickled fish in those photos.
